recipe.hot: 1 shot of espresso in the white cup (smaller cup so the taste wont be watery)
recipe.cold: 1 shot of espresso in tall glass filled with ice all the way. If the cup not full after pouring the espresso, then add a little ice water and fill the rest with ice. Put more ice than water so that the taste won’t be water when customer takes the first sip.

recipe.hot: For flat white recommend to customer who can’t take strong coffee cos it is more milk and less foam. When steaming the milk, don’t make too much foam.
recipe.note: Flat white is only available in hot, no cold. If cold its just iced latte.

recipe.hot: 1 shot espresso in the brown cup and steam the milk with medium amount of foam. Latte has more foam than flat white but less foam than cappuccino.
recipe.cold: Put ice in the tall glass and fill ¾ with milk. The pour one shot of espresso and fill the balance with ice. Don’t put water in latte, if need more just add more ice or milk only.

recipe.hot: 1 shot espresso in the brown cup and steam the milk with more foam than latte.
recipe.cold: Put ice in the tall glass and fill ½ with milk. Then pour espresso. After that steam a little bit of milk with a lot of foam and put the foam layer at the top. Add a little cocoa powder over the foam once done

recipe.hot: 1 shot espresso in the brown cup and steam the milk with more foam than latte.
recipe.cold: Put ice in the tall glass and fill ½ with milk. Then pour espresso. After that steam a little bit of milk with a lot of foam and put the foam layer at the top. Add a little cocoa powder over the foam once done.

recipe.hot: Mix 1 table spoon of honey with 1 shot of espresso. Steam milk like latte and pour.
recipe.cold: fill glass with ice and pour two table spoon of honey. Fill the glass with milk. Mix some milk In the white pitcher with 1 teaspoon of honey and pour in the glass. Pour espresso in the glass after.
